There's a reason that a lot of "mix them all together" videos end up with similar colors! It's not just pure numbers, like which color is most common. What a lot of people don't know is that some pigments are stronger than others, and when you're mixing to get a certain color you have to be aware of any pigments you're using that might overpower the other colors.

Phthalo blue is so known for this that Gamblin, a company that makes high-quality artists' oil paints, actually suggests buying the color from their less expensive, less pigment-heavy "1980" line if you have trouble controlling it at full strength. Dioxazine purple is another strong pigment. Neither of those is super expensive as pigments go (the purple is slightly more expensive, but not bad), so they were probably used in the gel pens.
